result.execSummary:
The defendant Dekoda D. Wise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Victim appearing telephonically. Pfeifer states agreement/Shawl concurs. Court confirms that defendant agrees to withholding. Shawl states agreement as practical with VA benefits. Victim statement to Court that she has obtained documentation for withholding from VA benefits. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea. 09:10 AM Defendant Dekoda D. Wise in court, in custody, with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Schiek statement/possible resolution--requests short adjournment. Shawl statement--agrees w/adjournment for plea/sentencing. Victim statement--requests garnishment order. Court statement. Shawl statement/will explore possibility. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 11, 2019 at 08:45 am.

records.addlTxt: 01:28 PM Defendant Dekoda D. Wise in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Dekoda D. Wise in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appearing telephonically. Defense does not object to motion to rescind. No preliminary hearing was scheduled.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.   Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Shawl willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and stands mute as to charges. Court enters not guilty pleas on defendant's behalf. Bail continued. Adj. 1:32 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2019 at 09:00 am.

10:52 a.m. Defendant Dekoda D. Wise in court, in custody, with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
